summary: An educational video that explores the sources and impact of wastewater, including real-world consequences of water pollution and solutions such as water treatment and conservation.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen that transitions to a logo featuring a white stick figure with a red cape, accompanied by the text "CAREER AHEAD" in white letters. The scene then shifts to an animated setting where two characters, one in a white shirt and black pants and the other in a white shirt and blue pants, stand on either side of a blue board with the text "Wastewater Story Part - 1" and a smiling water droplet character. The background depicts a serene outdoor scene with a body of water and trees. The focus then moves to the water droplet character, who appears to be speaking in a classroom setting with students in the background. The text "Water is very important not only for humans, but also for animals, birds, and plants" appears at the bottom of the screen. The water droplet character continues to speak, and the scene transitions to show four circular icons representing "Increasing Population," "Increasing Industrialization," "Expansion in Agriculture," and "Increasing Urbanization," each with corresponding illustrations. The video concludes with the water droplet character still speaking, surrounded by these icons, emphasizing the importance of water in various aspects of life.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with playful, whimsical music, featuring pizzicato strings, setting a light-hearted mood. A female narrator begins speaking in an informative tone, introducing a "waste water story" and explaining the importance of water for life, humans, animals, birds, and plants. She elaborates on factors like increasing population and industrialization causing a decrease in the water level. The narrative asks if the available water is clean and useful.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a blue water droplet character standing in a classroom, surrounded by students. The droplet has a friendly face with red lips and expressive eyes, and it appears to be speaking or presenting. The classroom setting includes desks, a world map on the wall, and a bulletin board. The scene transitions to a close-up of three students sitting at desks, each with an open book in front of them. The students are wearing white shirts, and the classroom has a window with a view of the outside. One student is shown in a thought bubble, dreaming of sleeping in bed, while the other two students are engaged in conversation. The next scene shows the same three students, with thought bubbles depicting a doctor and a factory, indicating a discussion about health and pollution. The video then shifts to a teacher standing in front of a blackboard, addressing the class. The teacher is wearing glasses and a white shirt, and the classroom has a potted plant on the wall. The final scene features three girls in blue uniforms with white collars, standing in front of the class. One girl is speaking, and an orange text box appears above her, stating, "When water is polluted, then we get water-borne diseases." The classroom setting remains consistent throughout the video, with desks, books, and a world map visible in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an educational female narrator introducing a video about wastewater, aiming to explore the topic with a visit to a village. Two females with childlike voices converse, one inquiring about the other's health and noting they look tired and sick. The other explains that she was sick with fever and vomiting and that the doctor attributed her illness to water pollution. The first female notes the arrival of a male, presumably a teacher, as they all greet him. The teacher, addressing the children, asks about one of their health and the child states they had a waterborne disease. He then asks if they can explain how people get sick from water, to which one of the children responds that it's due to polluted water causing waterborne diseases. The teacher acknowledges this, mentioning that people get sick from wastewater or dirty water.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in a classroom setting where a teacher, dressed in a white shirt, stands in front of a blackboard, pointing towards it while addressing a group of students seated at desks. The students, wearing blue uniforms with white collars, are attentively listening. The classroom is decorated with a framed picture of a plant and a circular portrait on the wall. The teacher asks the students, "What is Wastewater?" as indicated by the text on the screen. The scene transitions to a close-up of a student in a blue uniform, with an orange text box stating, "When we bathe and the water is filled with lather, it becomes dirty water." This is followed by an illustration of a child taking a shower, with water droplets and soap suds around them, emphasizing the concept of wastewater. The video then returns to the classroom, where the teacher explains that wastewater includes domestic water and water generated after commercial use. The students are shown again, with one girl raising her hand to ask a question. The teacher continues to explain, and the video shows a girl in a blue uniform speaking, with images of various activities like washing hands, dishes, and clothes appearing around her. The video concludes with a text overlay defining grey water as water containing vegetable matter, oil, hair oil, detergent, floor dust, and soapy water after washing the human body. The classroom setting remains consistent throughout, with the students and teacher engaged in the lesson.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker in a teacher-like tone, introducing the topic of wastewater and asking how water gets dirty. A child's voice, presumably female, responds, mentioning bathing and "filled with leather" to describe dirty water. The male speaker confirms the response as correct. He further explains that domestic water and water from commercial use is called wastewater or dirty water. The child responds again, describing how water from washing utensils, bathing, hands and clothes is dirty water. The male confirms that this water contains vegetable matter, oil, hair oil, detergent, floor dust, and soapy water from washing and terms it as "grey water". There is some indistinct noise at the end of the clip.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in a classroom setting where a young boy, dressed in a white shirt, stands at the front of the room, gesturing with his right hand as if explaining something to his classmates. The classroom features a window with a view of the outside, and the walls are adorned with a framed picture of a plant and a portrait of Mahatma Gandhi. The students, also in white shirts, are seated at their desks, attentively listening to the boy's presentation. The scene then transitions to a wider view of the classroom, showing the teacher, also in a white shirt, standing at the front near a blackboard, gesturing towards the students. The classroom is filled with students, some with their backs to the camera, and the desks are arranged in rows. The video then shifts to a close-up of two circular images: one depicting a toilet and the other showing sewage being flushed into a drain. Accompanying text explains that the water released from flushing human excreta and used for washing is called "black water" or "sewage." The video maintains a focus on the educational theme, emphasizing the importance of understanding and managing sewage in a classroom environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features two speakers, a child and an adult, engaging in a conversation. The child begins by posing a question, mentioning "water that we used in the toilets too" in a curious tone. The adult, presumably a male, responds matter-of-factly, defining the water released from "flushing the human excreta" as "black water or sewage."

events_list.video_caption:
The video begins with a blue animated water droplet character with a smiling face, arms, and legs, standing in a darkened classroom setting. The character appears to be addressing an audience, likely students, as suggested by the silhouettes of children in the background. The scene transitions to a text overlay that reads, "When it rains or the drain is filled, you see that the water flows on the roads. Observe this water. Write the color, smell or any other observation of this flowing water and discuss it with your teacher." This text encourages students to observe and record details about water flow, emphasizing the importance of observation and discussion in learning.

The video then shifts to a classroom scene where a student is holding up a circular image depicting a river flowing through a landscape with a house nearby. This visual aids in illustrating the concept of water flow. The next scene shows a teacher standing in front of a chalkboard, gesturing towards a diagram of a drainage system. The teacher appears to be explaining the concept of water flow and drainage to the students, who are attentively listening. The classroom is filled with students, some of whom are looking at the teacher, while others are looking at the chalkboard. The teacher's gestures and the visual aids on the chalkboard help to convey the educational content effectively.

The video continues with the teacher pointing towards a diagram on the chalkboard, which illustrates a drainage system with arrows indicating the flow of water. The students are shown with thought bubbles containing images of water flow and drainage systems, indicating their understanding and engagement with the lesson. The classroom environment is depicted as a typical educational setting with desks, books, and a chalkboard, creating an atmosphere conducive to learning. The video emphasizes the importance of visual aids and interactive teaching methods in enhancing students' comprehension of water flow and drainage systems.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a warm, instructional female voice prompting children to observe water flow and discuss their observations, maintaining a calm and encouraging tone.  A child's voice replies, stating they see water flowing into drains.  A male voice then asks if they have noticed pipes at home. Another child answers that they have. The audio takes place in a classroom, as implied from the teacher-student interactions and speaking tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in a classroom where a teacher, dressed in a white shirt, stands in front of a blackboard explaining the concept of sewers. The text on the blackboard reads, "Pipes that carry dirty water, are called sewers." The classroom is filled with students wearing blue uniforms, attentively listening to the teacher. The scene transitions to a close-up of a circular inset showing a house with a red roof, a water tank, and a sewer system, illustrating the flow of clean and dirty water. The inset zooms in to show the details of the water flow, with labels indicating "Clean Water" and "Dirty Water." The video then shifts to an underground sewer system, depicting pipes and water flowing through a tunnel, emphasizing the infrastructure involved in sewage management. The scene returns to the classroom, where a group of students, also in blue uniforms, are engaged in a discussion. One student stands and gestures while speaking, and the others listen attentively, with a world map visible on the wall behind them. The video concludes with the students continuing their discussion, highlighting the educational environment and the importance of understanding sewage systems.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male narrator explaining the function of sewers in carrying "dirty water" and the existence of manholes every "50 to 60 meters." The narrator speaks in a clear, informative tone. A child, seemingly female, then asks if the "muddy water causes water pollution," expressing concern about where the water goes. The narrator responds affirmatively. Background music with a gentle, neutral tone plays throughout, featuring what sound like strings.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in a classroom setting where a teacher, dressed in a white shirt, stands in front of a blackboard, gesturing as he explains something to a group of attentive students. The students, wearing blue uniforms with red ribbons, are seated at wooden desks, each with an open book and a green notebook. The classroom is decorated with a framed picture of a plant on the wall and a portrait of Mahatma Gandhi. The scene transitions to a darker setting where the teacher continues to explain, and circular images appear on the screen, illustrating various aspects of water systems, including pipes, a blue pipe with water flowing, a water treatment plant, and a coiled pipe. The focus then shifts to a thought bubble above one of the students, depicting a worried boy with a fever, surrounded by circular images representing different diseases such as Typhoid, Hepatitis, Cholera, Skin Diseases, Dysentery, and Diarrhea. The video emphasizes the importance of understanding water systems and their impact on health, using visual aids to educate the students about the potential health risks associated with contaminated water.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male narrator explaining the impact of dirty water contamination from poor sewage systems, mentioning diseases like typhoid, hepatitis, and cholera. His tone is informative and serious. Then a different female voice says a surprised "Oh".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins in a classroom setting with three students, two boys and one girl, all dressed in white shirts. The boy in the foreground stands and gestures with his right hand, while the other two students sit behind him, each with a green book on their desks. The background features a window and a green wall. The scene transitions to a group of four girls in blue uniforms with white collars, seated at desks with green books. One girl stands and gestures, while the others sit, with a world map visible on the wall behind them. The video then shows a wider view of the classroom, including a teacher in a white shirt standing in front of a blackboard, with students seated at desks, some with green books. The teacher gestures with his right hand, and the classroom has a framed picture of a plant on the wall. The video concludes with the teacher continuing to gesture, while the students remain seated, focused on the lesson.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a female voice expressing discomfort, saying "Oh, I feel sick due to this". A male voice then asks, "Sir, then what can we do with the wastewater?". The first male voice replies that "we should not let the dirty water go waste".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a classroom scene where a teacher, dressed in a white shirt, stands in front of a blackboard, addressing students who are seated at desks with books open in front of them. The classroom is decorated with a framed picture of a plant on the wall and a clock showing the time. The teacher gestures with his hands as he speaks, engaging the students who are attentively listening. The scene transitions to a text overlay on a dark background, stating, "We should not let the dirty water go waste. By removing contaminants from it, it can be made clean and reused again." This message emphasizes the importance of water conservation and treatment. The video then shifts to an illustration of a water treatment plant, showcasing various components such as tanks, pipes, and a water tower, with the label "Water Treatment Plant" prominently displayed. The illustration is set against a backdrop of a pond with lily pads and a barren tree, highlighting the natural environment. The video returns to the classroom, where the teacher continues to explain, now with a student standing and gesturing, possibly asking a question or making a point. The teacher responds, maintaining the educational atmosphere. The video concludes with the teacher standing in front of the blackboard, continuing his lecture, while the students remain engaged, reinforcing the theme of learning and environmental awareness.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker, presenting information about water, saying, "By removing contaminants from it, it can be made clean and reused again," in an informative tone. A female voice responds with curiosity, stating, "Can so much dirty water be purified?" The male speaker affirms, explaining that "dirty water is sanitized with the help of a water treatment plant," in a calm manner. The female asks a clarifying question "Will we not get sick from reusing this water?" expressing worry. The male speaker responds that "due to the continuous scarcity of clean water, the dirty water is cleaned and reused," his tone staying calm and instructional.

events_list.video_caption:
The video begins in a classroom setting where a teacher, dressed in a white shirt, stands at the front of the room, gesturing with his hands as he addresses the students. The students, wearing blue uniforms with white collars, are seated at wooden desks, attentively listening to the teacher. The classroom is decorated with a framed picture of a plant on the wall and a portrait of Mahatma Gandhi above the blackboard. The teacher's animated gestures suggest he is explaining a topic, and the students appear engaged in the lesson.

As the video progresses, the teacher continues to speak, and the students remain focused on him. The classroom environment remains consistent, with the same decorations and a world map visible on the wall behind the students. The teacher's gestures become more pronounced, indicating an emphasis on certain points of his explanation.

The scene then transitions to a close-up of the students, highlighting their attentive expressions and the details of their uniforms. The students' engagement is evident as they listen intently to the teacher's instructions. The classroom setting remains unchanged, with the world map still visible in the background.

The video then returns to the teacher at the front of the room, continuing his explanation with animated gestures. The students, still in their blue uniforms, remain seated at their desks, focused on the teacher's words. The classroom environment, including the framed picture of a plant and the portrait of Mahatma Gandhi, remains consistent throughout the video.

The video concludes with the teacher still addressing the students, who continue to listen attentively. The classroom setting remains unchanged, with the same decorations and the world map visible on the wall. The teacher's animated gestures and the students' focused expressions suggest an ongoing and engaging lesson.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker warning that untreated sewage will pollute water sources and thus, "water must be treated." A female speaker then asks how this treatment is done, to which the male speaker replies that he will explain tomorrow, as it is now time to leave. The audio clip ends with the sound of a door closing.

events_list.video_caption:
The video begins in a classroom setting where a teacher, dressed in a white shirt, stands in front of a blackboard, gesturing with his hands as he addresses the students. The students, wearing blue and white uniforms, are seated at wooden desks, attentively listening to the teacher. The classroom is decorated with a framed picture of a plant on the wall and a portrait of Mahatma Gandhi, adding a touch of cultural significance to the environment. The atmosphere is one of focused learning, with the teacher actively engaging the students in the lesson.

The scene then transitions to a close-up of two students seated at their desks, both wearing white shirts. One student, with short black hair, is seated in the foreground, while another student, with slightly longer black hair, is seated behind him. A third student, also in a white shirt, stands between them, gesturing with his hand as if explaining something to the seated students. The background features a window with white panes, allowing natural light to illuminate the classroom. The atmosphere here is one of interaction and discussion among the students, suggesting a collaborative learning environment.

The video then returns to the initial classroom setting, with the teacher continuing to address the students from the front of the room. The students remain seated at their desks, maintaining their focus on the teacher. The classroom's decor, including the framed plant picture and the portrait of Mahatma Gandhi, remains consistent, reinforcing the cultural and educational context of the scene. The atmosphere continues to be one of attentive learning, with the teacher actively engaging the students in the lesson.

The video concludes with a black screen, indicating a transition or a pause in the narrative. The absence of visual elements suggests a moment of reflection or a break in the storyline, leaving the viewer to ponder the previous scenes of learning and interaction.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a man speaking in a serious tone, emphasizing the importance of saving water and avoiding waste. A younger voice, presumably a child, responds by reiterating the need for water conservation. Another man then expresses agreement and dismisses the group. Children respond in unison by thanking the man. There is no background or ambient sounds or music.

events_list.video_caption: The video features an animated blue water droplet character with a smiling face, arms, and legs, standing in a classroom setting with students seated at desks. The character appears to be speaking or presenting, as indicated by its expressive gestures and facial expressions. The classroom background includes a blackboard and framed pictures on the walls. The scene transitions to a black screen with white text that reads, "Many diseases are spread due to water pollution. That is why dirty water should not be mixed with clean water." This message emphasizes the importance of clean water and the dangers of water pollution. The video then returns to the animated water droplet character, continuing its presentation in the classroom. The final frames display the text "TCTACLEARN.ORG" on a black background with a blue wave design, indicating the source or organization behind the video. The overall atmosphere is educational, with a focus on raising awareness about water pollution and its health implications.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with an instructional tone as a single female speaker announces that "in this video you have learned about wastewater". She discusses the spread of diseases through water pollution and advises against mixing dirty and clean water, stating that the next video will be about cleaning wastewater. The speaker concludes with "see you". Light and cheerful background music plays with a playful rhythm, featuring string instruments.
